title: sadog
author: sadog
content: I See In The Programmers Community's That All Talk About Web3 As A Technology, And Web5 As A Meme, But Really, How Much Can Web3 Stay Before Any Other Generation Of Web? And Can Web3 Be The Last Generation?

comments.author: bitmover
comments.body: Looks like people just use fancy words at random and are clueless about their meaning Web 3 is just the decentralized web. It is a possible future, which we are not even there yet. Our mainly applications today are all based in social media and high use of personal data  , which is the web 2.0A web 4 or 5 will eventually happen, after some disruptive technology shows up. It will take some years for sure.I recently made a summary about web 1 2 and 3:Quote from: bitmover on June 15, 2022, 06:22:46 PMA brief history of the web:Web 1.0:Static webpages, such as geocities. From 1990 to 2004. That web phase is also known  as "read only web"Web 2.0Since 2004 until today (yeah, we are on web 2)Read-write web.It growed with social media platforms where everyone can share content and read and write on the web. Main name is Facebook.There is a great problem with centralization and ownership of personal dataWeb 3Is related to decentralized app, and ia still in development.  Ethereum and bitcoin are the main names.Read-write-ownMore details here:https://ethereum.org/en/web3/
